author: VNExplorer
title: Al Qaeda setting up new training camps in Afghanistan, U.N. report says
text:
Second Anniversary Of Taliban‚Äôs Return To Power
Al Qaeda has established eight new training camps and maintains several safehouses in Afghanistan, according to a report provided to the United Nations Security Council this week. The report, compiled by the council‚Äôs committee created to monitor al Qaeda, indicates that the Taliban has not honored its pledge to the U.S. ‚Äì outlined in the Doha agreement ‚Äì to sever ties with the terror group, and that the two organizations remain close.
The Taliban has provided increased protection and support for al Qaeda members since regaining control over Afghanistan in 2021, when U.S. forces pulled out, the report says.
According to the report presented to the Security Council, the group behind the Sept. 11, 2001 terror attacks on the U.S. has established ‚Äúup to eight new training camps in Afghanistan, including four in Ghazni, Laghman, Parwan and Uruzgan Provinces, with a new base to stockpile weaponry in the Panjshir Valley.‚Äù
The terrorist organization also operates five madrasas ‚Äì religious schools where it trains and indoctrinates children to become fighters ‚Äì in the east and northeast of Afghanistan, the reports said. It also controls several safehouses in the capital, Kabul, and Herat province, from whereit facilitates the movement of its members and liaisons between its leadership in the country and its top leadership in neighboring Iran, the report says.
The Taliban released a statement denying the report, saying that the United Nations is ‚Äúalways spreading propaganda.‚Äù
‚ÄúThere is no one related to al Qaeda in Afghanistan, nor does the Islamic Emirate allow anyone to use the territory of Afghanistan against others,‚Äù the statement said.
Al Qaeda‚Äôs current leader, Sayf al-Adl is believed to be based in Iran, according to the United Nations and the U.S. Justice Department, which is offering a $10 million reward for information on his exact whereabouts.
Taliban-al Qaeda relations A year after the Taliban‚Äôs takeover of Kabul, the U.S. killed al Qaeda‚Äôs then-leader Ayman al-Zawahri with a drone strike in Kabul‚Äôs diplomatic district. He was inside a guest house belonging to the Taliban‚Äôs Interior Minister, who is also the leader of the powerful Taliban-affiliated Haqqani network, Sirajuddin Haqqani.
‚ÄúThe presence of al Qaeda senior figures in the country has not changed, and the group continues to pose a threat in the region and potentially beyond,‚Äù the U.N. report warns. It notes, however, that in its assessment, ‚Äúthe group cannot at present project sophisticated attacks at long range.‚Äù
Analysts believe al Qaeda is now a much weaker organization than it used to be, and many doubt the Taliban would allow activities that would jeopardize the U.S. humanitarian support provided to Afghanistan, which remains vital to preventing a humanitarian crisis in the country.
‚ÄúAre there training camps in Afghanistan? It is entirely possible. But their capacity to hit targets outside the immediate South Asian region is minimal,‚Äù veteran regional analyst Torek Farhadi told CBS News. ‚ÄúThe Taliban are careful not to let such activities develop, as they are in contact with U.S. authorities.‚Äù
‚ÄúThe U.S. is currently the largest humanitarian donor in Afghanistan through the U.N., but ultimately, this support has resulted in avoiding a further humanitarian crisis in the country. The Taliban recognize this precious U.S. support and will not risk upsetting this arrangement,‚Äù he said.
On Tuesday, the U.S. Special Inspector General for Afghanistan Reconstruction said the international community had provided at least $2.9 billion in aid to Afghanistan since August 2021, some $2.6 billion of which came from the U.S. government.

author: PA News Agency
title: Thousands of homes remain without power in wake of Storm Gerrit | Daily Echo
text:
Thousands of homes remain without power as the post-storm cleanup begins in the wake of Storm Gerrit.
Around 1,500 homes in Scotland experienced their second night without power in Scotland while a lightning strike hit supplies in Wales on Thursday.
Power company Scottish and Southern Electricity Networks said it had restored supply to more than 46,000 properties that lost power due to the storm, with people in the north east and Shetland worst affected.
‚ö° We've now restored power to 46k customers #stormgerrit üè† 1.5k will be off overnight, we're giving help & advice.üë∑ Teams are working tonight to clear debris hindering access to faults.‚òï Full details of vans serving hot meals from 9am tomorrow are at https://t.co/HSBcM400Fh pic.twitter.com/pnHIApyUvC
‚Äî Scottish and Southern Electricity Networks (@ssencommunity) December 28, 2023
They said the remaining homes should be reconnected on Friday with welfare vans serving hot food and drink to affected customers from 9am.
Operations director Andy Smith said: ‚ÄúThis has been a difficult couple of days for the communities affected and I‚Äôm grateful to them for their patience and support as our teams work extremely hard to restore power.‚Äù
National Grid UK said 36,000 properties were without power in Ceredigion on Thursday after lightning struck.
Storm Gerrit strongest gusts. See story WEATHER Gerrit. Infographic PA Graphics. An editable version of this graphic is available if required. Please contact graphics@pamediagroup.com. Three men died after their 4√ó4 vehicle was submerged in the River Esk, near Glaisdale, on Thursday, North Yorkshire Police said.
A supercell thunderstorm moved across the northwest of England on Thursday after a similar storm is thought to have resulted in a tornado that damaged homes in Greater Manchester on Wednesday.
Around 100 properties were damaged by what police called a ‚Äúlocalised tornado‚Äù in Stalybridge, Tameside and in the badly-hit village of Carrbrook.
Hayley McCaffer, 40, who lives in Carrbrook, told the PA news agency that some of her neighbours‚Äô houses ‚Äúare an absolute disaster‚Äù with missing roofs and ‚Äúsquished‚Äù cars.
Damage will be covered by standard property insurance policies, the Association of British Insurers has said.
Screengrab taken from PA Video of a damaged gate in Stalybridge after the Tameside tornado (Richard McCarthy/PA) ScotRail said many lines have been reopened but urged passengers to check for the latest information before travelling, a message echoed by LNER, Avanti West Coast and London Northwestern Railway who suspensed or cancelled services due to damage or system faults.
Friday will see significant disruption for travellers wishing to travel on the London Euston and Watford Junction lines with services expected to be up and running by the end of the day.
In Wales, the aftermath of the recent severe weather will see rail services hampered until Monday.
üå¶Ô∏è Blustery showers are possible on Friday morning, with these most likely in the north and west. Many of us will also see some sunshine and some places may stay dry.
üå¨Ô∏è Still windy in northern England and later Shetland, with gales possible, but otherwise somewhat less windy. pic.twitter.com/hInP8LNF2c
‚Äî Met Office (@metoffice) December 28, 2023
Ferry services also experienced cancellations and delays due to storm activity with operator DFDS confirming sailings between Dover and France were delayed due to strong winds in the English Channel.
Air travel in and out of the UK saw cancellations but most services have returned to normal.
The Met Office reported the worst of Storm Gerrit had passed with the last few days of 2023 forecast to be unsettled with strong winds, rain and even snow on higher ground.
Met Office chief forecaster Steven Ramsdale said: ‚ÄúHeavy rain will spread across all but the far north on Saturday, affecting similar areas previously affected by Storm Gerrit. However, this rainfall will be a step down from that seen during Storm Gerrit.‚Äù

author: PTI
title: MCD transforms Wazirpur pollution hotspot with 1.75 acre green cover | Science-Environment
text: MCD transforms Wazirpur pollution hotspot with 1.75 acre green cover [PTI](https://www.devdiscourse.com/pti-stories)| New Delhi | Updated: 16-02-2024 14:34 IST | Created: 16-02-2024 14:34 IST - Country: - India The Municipal Corporation of Delhi has developed a 1.75 acre green cover in northwest Delhi's Wazirpur locality, a heavily industrialised region and among the top pollution hotspots in the capital, to mitigate the impact of the local sources of air pollution in the area. The civic body planted a total of 16,000 saplings of indigenous varieties on a vacant land that had turned into a garbage dumping point to develop a mini forest in the region using the Miyawaki technique, an official aware of the development told PTI. ''The Horticulture department of the MCD in collaboration with an NGO converted the vacant land used for garbage dumping to create a mini forest in the area that will help in improving the air quality levels in the region. We have utilised 1 acre of land for plantation and the rest of the land is used to develop pedestal crossing, install swings, and benches,'' he said. Wazirpur is among the 13 identified pollution hotspots in the national capital that contribute to the higher pollution levels in the city in comparison to other states. Delhi-NCR recorded the longest spell of 'very poor' or 'worse' air quality including maximum number of smog episodes between November and December in 2023 when compared to the last six years, according to a report by the Centre for Science and Environment. To mitigate the effect of air pollutants on the residents in such areas, the MCD is working on increasing the green cover in the city and develop parks and vacant lands into mini forests. The civic body also plans to create a green fence around the periphery of Bhalswa landfill site, one of the three garbage dumping points in Delhi, by clearing five to 10 metres of land and plant around 50 native species of plants. ''We have got the permission to start the work by next month. An MoU has been signed between the MCD and the Green Yatra Trust to carry out the work. This will help improving the ground water level, enhance biodiversity, and mitigate dust in the neighbouring area along with covering the garbage mountain with a green belt,'' the official said. Species such as pipal, babul, pilkhan, banyan, jamun, neem, among others will be used for plantation at the landfill site. The Miyawaki method of forestation helps in creating green belts in urban areas in a shorter span of time as compared to the time consumed to conventional forests. (This story has not been edited by Devdiscourse staff and is auto-generated from a syndicated feed.)

author: AB Newswire
title: Pixune: Pushing the Boundaries of 3D Animation with Unmatched Creativity
text:
Pixune: Pushing the Boundaries of 3D Animation with Unmatched Creativity By: AB Newswire April 02, 2025 at 17:16 PM EDT Introduction
3D animation has revolutionized the world of entertainment, gaming, marketing, and more. One studio that has mastered the craft of storytelling through breathtaking visuals is Pixune . Whether you‚Äôre looking for high-quality character animation, engaging game cinematics, or impressive advertising visuals, Pixune delivers stunning results. This article dives deep into Pixune‚Äôs expertise, services, and what makes it stand out in the competitive world of 3D animation.
What is 3D Animation?
3D animation is the process of creating moving digital images in a three-dimensional space. This technique is widely used in films, video games, advertisements, and virtual reality.
The Evolution of 3D Animation
From early CGI effects in movies to photorealistic animations in modern games, 3D animation has come a long way. Studios like Pixune are at the forefront of this evolution, constantly pushing boundaries. Pixune is a top-tier 3D animation studio known for creating stunning visuals that bring stories to life.
Why Choose Pixune for 3D Animation?
Expertise: Years of experience in delivering high-quality 3D animation. Creativity: A team of passionate artists and animators. Technology: Cutting-edge tools for seamless animation. Customization: Tailored solutions to meet specific client needs.
Services Offered by Pixune Character Animation
Pixune specializes in breathing life into characters with realistic expressions and movements.
Game Cinematics
Game developers rely on Pixune to create immersive cinematics that captivate players.
Architectural Visualization
From real estate to urban planning, Pixune‚Äôs 3D animations help visualize projects with stunning accuracy.
Motion Graphics
Perfect for branding and advertising, Pixune‚Äôs motion graphics add a dynamic touch to marketing campaigns.
Product Animation
Pixune helps businesses showcase their products in 3D, making presentations more engaging and informative.
The Creative Process at Pixune
Concept Development ‚Äì Understanding the client‚Äôs vision. Storyboarding ‚Äì Creating a visual blueprint. Modeling ‚Äì Designing characters and environments. Texturing and Rigging ‚Äì Adding realism and movement capabilities. Animation ‚Äì Bringing everything to life. Rendering ‚Äì Producing the final high-quality output. Post-Production ‚Äì Editing and refining the animation.
Industries That Benefit from Pixune‚Äôs 3D Animation
Entertainment (Movies, TV Shows) Gaming (Game Trailers, Cutscenes) Marketing & Advertising (Commercials, Product Demos) Education & Training (E-learning, Simulations) Architecture & Real Estate (Virtual Tours, Concept Visualization)
Pixune‚Äôs Commitment to Quality and Innovation
Pixune doesn‚Äôt just follow industry standards; it sets them. With a focus on innovation and precision, the studio ensures every project exceeds expectations.
Tools and Technologies Used at Pixune
Autodesk Maya ‚Äì For modeling and animation Blender ‚Äì Open-source 3D creation ZBrush ‚Äì Digital sculpting Adobe After Effects ‚Äì Post-production enhancements Unity & Unreal Engine ‚Äì Game development
Behind the Scenes: How a 3D Animation is Made
The journey from a concept to a final animated video involves multiple stages, each requiring skill, patience, and attention to detail.
The Importance of Storytelling in 3D Animation
Great animation isn‚Äôt just about visuals; it‚Äôs about compelling storytelling. Pixune ensures every project has a strong narrative backbone.
Pixune‚Äôs Top 3D Animation Projects
Fantasy RPG Game Cinematics Realistic Product Commercials Animated Short Films
The Role of AI in 3D Animation
Artificial Intelligence is transforming animation workflows, making processes faster and more efficient. Pixune leverages AI to enhance production quality.
The Future of 3D Animation
With advancements in VR, AR, and AI, the future of 3D animation looks more promising than ever. Pixune continues to adapt to these changes to stay ahead of the curve.
How to Hire Pixune for Your 3D Animation Needs
Interested in working with Pixune ? Visit their official website, check out their portfolio, and reach out for a consultation.
Conclusion
Pixune has established itself as a leader in the 3D animation industry. With a commitment to quality, innovation, and storytelling, the studio continues to create breathtaking animations for a diverse range of clients. If you're looking for a professional 3D animation studio, Pixune is your go-to choice.
